column1: One of the only major phrases known to outsiders is their battle-cry: ''[[Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!]]'' meaning ''Axes of the Dwarves! The Dwarves are upon you!''

The Dwarves were secretive by nature and their native names were considered too intimate to reveal to outsiders. In public life they took external names in the language of their surroundings. It is not known if these "outer" names are translations of their inner names
column2: or whether they had any relation
column3: or not. The [[Longbeards]] for example adopted [[Northern Mannish]] names.<ref>{{App|Languages}}</ref> Even [[Balin's Tomb]] displays these "outer" names of [[Balin]] and [[Fundin]]
column4: since there was always a possibility that the inscription would be read by strangers. Eventually they would make use of their "outer" names even among themselves.<ref name=DM/>
